channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-12658] Clear javadoc and check style issues around DomainSocket
item.description:
It was noticed Javadoc needs minor udpate in DomainSocket.
There are some other check style issues around to clear up found when working on HDFS-8562.
item.summary: Clear javadoc and check style issues around DomainSocket

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Uploaded a patch to update the JAVA doc and comments.
If you're deleting line 468, you should also delete 467.

-1 overall

This message was automatically generated.
Looks good to me. I haven't validated that the changes are actually accurate, though.
Sorry, but I would probably handle this together in HDFS-8562. When that's in if possible, this will be marked as duplicate, otherwise will move on this.
I re-purposed this to handle more check style issues to be cleared up sooner found in HDFS-8562.
Hi umamaheswararao, could you help review this? I thought this clear up would be better to be in. Thanks.

About IOException, there was a comment here in HDFS-8562 I forgot to address:

SocketTimeoutException is timeouts, other IOExceptions could be other things. Maybe have two lines about exceptions, one for IOE and another for timeout?

SocketTimeoutException is also an IOException. Having the both in the throw list would not look clean. Not adding SocketTimeoutException explicitly doesn't prevent callers from handling it specially. If we'd like to add SocketTimeoutException in the accept() method throw list, we might need to do it as well for other methods. More suggestions are welcome.

Hi Kai,
Thanks for the patch. 

+  private static native int connect0(String path) throws IOException;;

Please remove unnecessary “;"

  * @param path         The path to connect to.
+   * @throws IOException                  If there was an I/O error
+   *                                      performing the connect
    * @return             The new DomainSocket.

Please maintain consistent spacing for clean look.

 /**
   * Receive some FileDescriptor objects from the process on the other side of
  /**
   * Receive some FileDescriptor objects from the process on the other side of

did not cleanup the code well. 2 lines missed to remove I think. Please check
Thanks Uma for the careful review! I'll update the patch to address them.
Updated the patch addressing review comments.
